question: What is "Berlinale"?
option1: A special kind of wine produced in Berlin
option2: A film festival held annually in Berlin
option3: A cold-war era ammunition stationed in Berlin
option4: A critically endangered deer species unique to Berlin
answer: A film festival held annually in Berlin
explanation: "Berlinale" is a film festival held annually in Berlin, the capital city of Germany. The Berlin International Film Festival, also known as "the Berlinale", is a film festival held annually in Berlin, Germany. Founded in West Berlin in 1951, the festival has been held every February since 1978 and is one of the "Big Three" alongside the Venice Film Festival in Italy and the Cannes Film Festival in France. It has the largest public attendance of any annual film festival. The festival's top awards are called the Golden Bear and Silver Bears.
